org.spongepowered.api.service

Interface ServiceManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleServiceManager

    public interface ServiceManager
    A manager of services and their providers.

    A service is a standard interface or class. A provider is an implementation of that service. A manager tracks registered providers with the service(s) that the provider implements.

    Providers are registered at runtime using setProvider(Object, Class, Object). Only one provider can be registered for each service, but a provider can be marked as replaceable if it can be replaced with a new provider.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Return reference to a provider for the given service that may exist now or at any point in the future.

      Return a provider for the given service, if one is available.
      <T> T provideUnchecked(java.lang.Class<T> service)
      Return a provider for the given service, raising an unchecked exception if a provider does not exist.
      <T> void setProvider(java.lang.Object plugin, java.lang.Class<T> service, T provider)
      Register a provider with the service manager.

    • Method Detail

      • setProvider

        <T> void setProvider(java.lang.Object plugin,
                     java.lang.Class<T> service,
                     T provider)
              throws ProviderExistsException
        Register a provider with the service manager.

        If a provider already exists for the given service, it will be replaced if was flagged as replaceable. Otherwise, a ProviderExistsException will be thrown. Plugins should provide options to not install their providers if the plugin is not dedicated to a single function (such as purely authorization).

        Services should only be registered during initialization. If services are registered later, then they may not be utilized.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of service
        Parameters:
        plugin - The instance of a plugin
        service - The service
        provider - The implementation
        Throws:
        ProviderExistsException - Thrown if a provider already exists and cannot be replaced
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if plugin is not a plugin instance

      • provide

        <T> com.google.common.base.Optional<T> provide(java.lang.Class<T> service)
        Return a provider for the given service, if one is available.

        The returned provider may be a proxy to the real underlying proxy, depending on the implementation of the service manager.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of service
        Parameters:
        service - The service
        Returns:
        A provider, if available

      • potentiallyProvide

        <T> ServiceReference<T> potentiallyProvide(java.lang.Class<T> service)
        Return reference to a provider for the given service that may exist now or at any point in the future.

        This allows performing actions when a service is registered, or on the existing service if it is already registered

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of service
        Parameters:
        service - The service
        Returns:
        A reference to a current or future provider

      • provideUnchecked

        <T> T provideUnchecked(java.lang.Class<T> service)
                throws ProvisioningException
        Return a provider for the given service, raising an unchecked exception if a provider does not exist.

        The returned provider may be a proxy to the real underlying proxy, depending on the implementation of the service manager.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of service
        Parameters:
        service - The service
        Returns:
        A provider
        Throws:
        ProvisioningException - Thrown if a provider cannot be provisioned
